text: Nina Aigner (born 20 June 1980 in Antiesenhofen, Austria) is a former Austrian football player. She played as striker and finished her career after the 2010–11 season. Her last team was FC Bayern München. Nina Aigner was also a talented tennis player and played at the age of 15 un the U16 team world championship where she won the bronce medal. ==Career== She started playing football for SV Peterskirchen. In 1998 she went on to Union Kleinmünchen Linz and won this season her first title in the ÖFB-Frauenliga. The next two seasons she played for Union Landhaus Vienna. She won the double with this club twice. In 2001 she went to FC Bayern München and played her first match versus SC Freiburg. She scored her first goal for the team in that game. Her last match was on 20 February 2011. With end of the season she finished her career. In 176 matches for München she scored 107 goals. In her whole career she scored 221 goals in 241 matches. During her time with Bayern she got a degree in sport marketing (2007) She played 29 matches and shot 7 goals for the Austrian women's national football team/ ==References== ==Other websites== *Players profile Weltfußball.de (German) *FC Bayern München- Frauenfußball:Statistik Nina Aigner Category:Austrian women's footballers Category:Players of the Austrian national football team Category:1980 births Category:Living people
title: Nina Aigner
